title: PJR Pull Over
description:
The PJR Pullover is a specialized exercise that targets the triceps while also engaging the chest and shoulders. It's a variation of the traditional pullover, but with a focus on building strength in the triceps. Hereâ€™s a breakdown of what you need to know about this workout:

How to Perform the PJR Pullover:
Starting Position:

Lie on a flat bench with your upper back and head supported.
Hold a dumbbell with both hands, arms extended above your chest.
Movement:

Lower the dumbbell behind your head in a controlled manner, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
Focus on stretching your triceps as you lower the weight.
Pull the dumbbell back up to the starting position, engaging your triceps throughout the movement.
Repetitions:

Aim for 3-4 sets of 8-12 repetitions, depending on your fitness level.
Benefits of the PJR Pullover:
Tricep Development: This exercise specifically targets the triceps, helping to build size and strength.
Upper Body Engagement: While the focus is on the triceps, it also works the chest and shoulders, making it a great compound movement.
Flexibility: The pullover motion can improve shoulder flexibility and mobility.
Tips for Success:
Control Your Movement: Avoid using momentum; focus on a slow and controlled motion to maximize muscle engagement.
Proper Weight: Start with a lighter weight to master the form before progressing to heavier dumbbells.
Breathing: Inhale as you lower the dumbbell and exhale as you lift it back up.
Incorporating the PJR Pullover into your workout routine can be a fantastic way to enhance your tricep strength and overall upper body development!

articles.title: DO's
list: DO warm up before starting the exercise. This could include light cardio, dynamic stretching, and some activation exercises for your shoulders and triceps
DO use a weight that is challenging but allows you to maintain good form throughout the entire range of motion. Don't sacrifice proper technique for heavier weight
DO keep your back flat on the bench throughout the exercise. This helps to maintain proper spinal alignment and prevents
DO engage your core muscles. This will help to stabilize your body and prevent unwanted movement
DO lower the dumbbell in a controlled manner. Don't let it crash down behind your head
DO focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement. This will help to maximize muscle activation
DO breathe properly. Inhale as you lower the dumbbell and exhale as you lift it back up
DO listen to your body. If you feel any pain, stop the exercise immediately

articles.title: DONT's
list: DON'T use excessive weight. Prioritize good form over lifting heavy
DON'T allow your back to arch. Keep your back flat on the bench throughout the entire movement
DON'T let the dumbbell swing. Control the weight throughout the entire range of motion
DON'T hold your breath. Breathe steadily throughout the exercise
DON'T ignore any pain. Stop the exercise immediately if you feel any discomfort
